title: Uber engineers built an AI version of their boss
summary: Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi said the company’s employees have gone all in on AI, going so far as to build a chatbot of him that they use to practice their pitches.
capabilities: Persona-Tuned LLM (Fine-tuned on CEO speech patterns and public transcripts)
RAG-Enhanced Strategy Retrieval (Integrated with internal Uber strategic documents)
practical_use_cases: Internal Team Training: Employees can stress-test high-stakes presentations against a simulated version of executive scrutiny.
Culture Scaling: Mid-level managers can use persona-bots to align projects with the CEO's specific priorities and communication style.
Developer Template: Curious developers can replicate this architecture using OpenAI's System Prompts + RAG to build 'Boss-Bots' for their own organizations.
executive_summary:
Uber's development of a digital twin for Dara Khosrowshahi marks a significant shift from generic productivity AI to specialized **Corporate Persona Agents**. Architecturally, this likely involves a base model (such as GPT-4o or an internal Llama-3 derivative) fine-tuned on the CEO’s public earnings calls, interviews, and internal memos. By utilizing Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), the bot doesn't just mimic his voice; it references specific Uber metrics and strategic pillars to provide contextually accurate feedback.

From a technical standpoint, the 'velocity gain' Dara mentions stems from reducing the 'feedback latency' for engineers. Instead of waiting for a quarterly review or a 15-minute sync, teams can iterate hourly against a simulated executive gatekeeper. This project highlights the ROI of **Internal LLM Utility**: by lowering the friction of alignment, Uber effectively increases its operational bandwidth without adding headcount. For the 'Curious Developer,' this is a blueprint for the next wave of B2B SaaS—customized executive agents that act as a bridge between high-level strategy and ground-level execution.
